content.question: A portion of the slope field for the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y with respect to x equals, x minus y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow></math> is shown in the figure. If the linear function <math alttext="y equals f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is the solution to the differential equation such that <math alttext="f of negative 1 equals negative 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>, then <math alttext="f of 3 equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
